page.title: 15The local environment.
page.content: The nature of the land is of mainly flat,open farmland interspersed by dykes, a canal and the yacht basin. Some of the water is fresh, whilst other is salt. The River Conder is a mixture of the two, and the area around Conder bridge is a bird-watchers paradise, particularly for waders, where conditions are ideal i.e. tidal waters and mud rich in crustaceans providing a constant source of food. One can also find here species such as heron,kingfisher and dipper. Most of the block lying west of the road running through the middle is completely flat, whilst that to the east contains a mixture of hills and broadleafed woodland.
